channel.title: Making you need a req [pi]
channel.description:
pi source 317
Ok so i add a lvl req but it doesnt work. or unless it not fully done coding
So i tryed making strenght skill cape need 99 strenght.
[code]case 9751: c.strengthLevelReq = 99; break;[/code]
Yet i still can weear at 1 str.

@noobcoderh2o wrote:

if(c.rangeLevelReq > 0) { if(c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]) < c.rangeLevelReq) { c.sendMessage("You need a range level of "+c.rangeLevelReq+" to wield this weapon."); canWearItem = false; } }

item.title: Making you need a req [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I said scroll down until you see

		switch(itemId) {
			case 8839:
			case 8840:
			case 8842:
			case 11663:
			case 11664:
			case 11665:
			c.attackLevelReq = 42;
			c.rangeLevelReq = 42;
			c.strengthLevelReq = 42;
			c.magicLevelReq = 42;
			c.defenceLevelReq = 42;
			return;

At the end of “return;” is where you add it

Read full topic

item.title: Making you need a req [pi]
item.dc:creator: @noobcoderh2o noobcoderh2o
item.description:
@noobcoderh2o wrote:

[code]if(itemName.contains(“verac”) || itemName.contains(“guthan”) || itemName.contains(“dharok”) || itemName.contains(“torag”)) {

		if(itemName.contains("hammers")) {
			c.attackLevelReq = 70;
			c.strengthLevelReq = 70;
		} else if(itemName.contains("axe")) {
			c.attackLevelReq = 70;
			c.strengthLevelReq = 70;
		} else if(itemName.contains("warspear")) {
			c.attackLevelReq = 70;
			c.strengthLevelReq = 70;
		} else if(itemName.contains("flail")) {
			c.attackLevelReq = 70;
			c.strengthLevelReq = 70;
		} else {
			c.defenceLevelReq = 70;
		}
	}
                [/code]

Thats what mine looks like. so do i add it in this code but under? or what/

Read full topic

item.title: Making you need a req [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Open ItemAssistant.java - search for

if(itemName.contains("verac") || itemName.contains("guthan") || itemName.contains("dharok") || itemName.contains("torag")) {

Then if you scroll down a tiny bit you’ll find something like this:

		switch(itemId) {
			case 8839:
			case 8840:
			case 8842:
			case 11663:
			case 11664:
			case 11665:
			c.attackLevelReq = 42;
			c.rangeLevelReq = 42;
			c.strengthLevelReq = 42;
			c.magicLevelReq = 42;
			c.defenceLevelReq = 42;
			return;

Now if you want to make your strength skillcape for people with 99 strength, you take this code:

case 9750:
c.strengthLevelReq = 99;
break;

Read full topic
